criteria: Accuracy in calculating area of two-dimensional shapes (triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons)
Accuracy in calculating volume and surface area of three-dimensional objects (cubes, right prisms)
Ability to solve real-world problems involving area, volume, and surface area
Correctly identifies and applies relevant geometric properties and theorems
descriptions: No attempt to calculate area or uses incorrect formulas and units.
Demonstrates minimal understanding; struggles to apply correct formulas; calculations are largely inaccurate; omits units or uses incorrect units.
Demonstrates partial understanding; applies correct formulas sporadically; calculations contain errors; struggles with appropriate units.
Demonstrates reasonable understanding; mostly applies correct formulas; calculations are generally accurate with minor errors; uses appropriate units for most calculations.
Demonstrates strong understanding; consistently applies correct formulas; calculations are accurate with negligible errors; consistently uses appropriate units.
Demonstrates comprehensive understanding; flawlessly applies correct formulas; calculations are perfectly accurate; consistently and appropriately uses units; explains reasoning.
